metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17092 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
wp-includes/functions.php in WordPress before 4.9.1 does not require theunfiltered_html capability for upload of .js files, which might allowremote attackers to conduct XSS attacks via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.5+dfsg1-1').
